item.title: Ticket #1863 (footer displaying wrong) created
item.dc:creator: darkfate
item.description:
the footer image is a little off. I figured it out pretty quickly though. In the style.css it displays: 

#footer {
	padding: 0 0 0 1px;
	margin: 0 auto;
	width: 760px;
	clear: both;
	}

When it should say: 

#footer {
	padding: 0 0 0 0px;
	margin: 0 auto;
	width: 760px;
	clear: both;
	}

item.title: Ticket #1526 (have wp-atom.php generate Atom 1.0 (fix attached)) updated
item.dc:creator: philor
item.description: The Atom produced by that latest patch should be flagged as invalid by the feedvalidator within a few hours, once it updates from CVS. type="xhtml" means inline XHTML, that you are so sure your content is well-formed that you don't use any CDATA escaping. If, as is probably the case for us, you can't *guarantee* well-formedness, you have to use type="html" with CDATA escaping.

item.description: Removing old cache files will put things back in order.

item.title: functions.php.diff attached to Ticket #1861
item.dc:creator: filosofo

item.title: Ticket #1861 (add_option does not work even for Changeset 3026) created
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
add_option does not add new options, because it checks to see if get_option does not return 'false' on the option, when it should check that get_option does not return 'null' (see attached diff file for the solution).

I apologize if this isn't considered "critical," but it seemed critical to me, as I can't get a number of plugins to work only because of it.

item.title: Ticket #1837 (Post timestamp does not correspond to publication time) updated
item.dc:creator: error
item.description:
Keywords changed

Patch works exactly as expected. Thanks!

item.title: Ticket #1471 (404s show the index page) updated
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
Keywords changed

The code in template-loader.php never loads the 404.php template because $qp_query->is_404 is never set to false as appropriate.

For a reason I have yet to track down, adding garbage to a SEO-friendly URL always returns a set of posts when the is_404 detection expects it to return 0.

As a result, the 404 template is never displayed.

item.title: Ticket #1625 (Multiple category support and category negation for get_posts()) updated
item.dc:creator: drac
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: Ticket #1625 (Multiple category support and category negation for get_posts()) updated
item.dc:creator: drac
item.description:
Owner changed

patch attached.

maintains compatibility with existing syntax for get_posts; but any category can now be negated by prefixing with $negation_char (I defined it as , but it can be changed easily). get_posts(numberposts=10&offset=0&category=3')

multiple categories are also supported with the parse_str array syntax get_posts(numberposts=10&offset=0&category[]=1+2+3')

Any category/categories in the array syntax can be negated individually. get_posts(numberposts=10&offset=0&category[]=1+2+3) asks for 1, 3 and negates 2. Can't think of a use for this yet though.

Didn't want to change the function signature, but I would like to resubmit this patch with an additional negateall parameter. False by default, this would allow a list of category ids to be marked as negated without prefixing each cat_id with the $negation_char. comments ?

item.title: Ticket #1860 (Add comment_count field to posts table) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description:
Attached is a patch to add a comment_count field to the posts table.

I had to move an action hook in front of the sql that deletes a comment because you can't do anything useful with deleted data!

Hooks included for adding/deleting/editing/changing status of comments.

item.title: Ticket #1853 (Trackback doesn't work through api) updated
item.dc:creator: tbrettinger
item.description:
I'm really no expert of either the WP code nor of PHP - but it looks as if blogger and MetaWeblog APIs call wp_insert_post / wp_update_post already in 1.5.2, but the MoveableType API doesn't.

Maybe that's where the problem is?

item.title: patch.txt attached to Ticket #1859
item.dc:creator: donncha

item.title: Ticket #1859 (Options not adding correctly) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description:
Options don't appear to be added correctly, at least for the last few days. It's possibly due to the new caching.

I investigated and in wp-includes/functions.php the get_settings() function returns a value that isn't "=== false" when an option does not exist. add_option uses this function to check if an option exists and therefore thinks the option's already there when it isn't. The attached patch uses get_row() instead of get_var() to query the options table, thus handling the event where option_value == 0.

item.title: Ticket #1857 (Some Cache Updates) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
This patch:

  • Adds a php tag around the data in the cache files to hide from viewing via a server request.
  • Extracts the cache data from inside the php tag before unserializing.
  • Saves the cache files with a php extension.
  • Adds a little snippet to make rename() work right on Win/PHP5.

item.title: Ticket #1856 (Link to upload.php is broken) created
item.dc:creator: Potter_System
item.description: In changeset 2923, matt deleted upload.php. However, it stills in the Admin menu when "Allow File Uploads" is selected. Will be deleted forever, or just will be created again?
